cutting of major vegetation to the ground, complete extraction or killing by
spraying, girdling, root cutting, or otherwise; however, "remove" or "removal"
does not include the pruning of trees in accordance with "Standard Practices
for Tree, Shrub, and Other Woody Plant Maintenance" (ANSI A300) and "Tree-
Pruning Guidelines" published by the International Society of Arboriculture or
similar standards and guidelines from time to time recommended by the Village
Forester.
SITE: A lot or parcel of land or a contiguous combination thereof where grading
is performed as a single unified operation.
SITE DEVELOPMENT PERMIT: A permit issued by the Village for any site
development work to be performed on a parcel pursuant to chapter 5 of this
title.
SITE DEVELOPMENT PLAN: A plan prepared under the direction of a professional
engineer that shows the existing and proposed conditions of the property to be
improved, the method and location of erosion control measures to be
implemented, proposed alterations of storm runoff or grading of lands,
installation of buried utilities, and the protection and removal of major
vegetation for the construction of buildings and other necessary improvements.
SITE DEVELOPMENT WORK: Any grading, filling or excavation on any parcel in
excess of ten (10) cubic yards in quantity, or removal of major vegetation or
alteration of overland drainage routes or any activity that is regulated by the
Lake County watershed development ordinance. Adding gravel to existing
driveways (to repair potholes) does not constitute site development work (so
long as the elevation of the driveway above adjoining natural grade is not
increased).
SITE PREPARATION PERMIT: A permit issued by the Village for predevelopment and
site safety activities on a parcel that must be completed in certain instances
before a building permit or site development permit will issue.
SITE PREPARATION PLAN: As defined in the Riverwoods zoning ordinance.
STRUCTURE: As defined in the Riverwoods zoning ordinance.
VILLAGE ENGINEER: One or more professional engineers engaged as an independent
contractor by the Village to serve as the Village's engineering consultant to
review all development activities in the Village, assist in the interpretation,
administration and enforcement of this title and perform such other duties as
may be assigned from time to time by the Village President.
VILLAGE FORESTER: One or more professional landscape consultants who are
engaged as an independent contractor by the Village to serve as the Village's
forestry consultant to review all development activities in the Village, assist
in the interpretation, administration and enforcement of this title and perform
such other duties as may be assigned from time to time by the Village
President.
ZONING BOARD OF APPEALS: The Zoning Board of Appeals of the Village. (Ord. 07-
4-6, 4-17-2007; amd. Ord. 09-7-15, 7-7-2009; Ord. 18-03-05, 3-6-2018)
CHAPTER 2
ADMINISTRATIVE PROVISIONS
SECTION:
8-2-1: Director Of Community Services
8-2-2: Building Official
8-2-3: Staff Review Committee
8-2-4: Permit Process Flow Chart
8-2-1: DIRECTOR OF COMMUNITY SERVICES:
There is hereby created the position of director of community services who
shall be appointed by the village president with the approval by a majority
vote of the board of trustees. The director of community services shall have
control and supervision over the building official and all other employees
assigned to the building department, subject to the supervision of the village
president. If suitably trained for inspection and code review services, the
director of community services shall perform the duties of the building
official at the request of the village president. The basic duties of the
director of community services shall be as follows:
   A.   Be responsible for the administration of all provisions of this title
for which administrative responsibilities are not otherwise assigned.
   B.   Receive all applications for site development permits and issue site
development permits in accordance with the requirements of this title.
Notwithstanding any provision to the contrary that may be contained in any
other provisions of this title, no site development permit shall be issued or
delivered by the director of community services to any person unless the permit
is countersigned by a member of the building and zoning committee.
   C.   In matters regarding civil engineering design, such as grading and
drainage, storm water detention, wetlands mitigation, utility extensions and
connections, the director of community services shall consult with and rely on
the advice rendered by the village engineer or other professional engineers
licensed by the state of Illinois recommended by the village engineer and
engaged by the village. In matters regarding the adequacy of landscaping, tree
preservation and protection of woodlands as required by village ordinances, the
director of community services shall consult with and rely on the advice
rendered by the village forester.
   D.   Make or arrange with the village engineer and village forester for the
necessary practical inspections of work performed in the field or reasonably
ascertain whether all conditions of each site development permit, ordinance
granting a variation, subdivision plat, development or easement agreement or
special use permit are complied with.
   E.   Keep a record of all inspections made, of reports rendered and of
notices of orders issued and deposit such records in the individual property
file. (Ord. 07-4-6, 4-17-2007)
8-2-2: BUILDING OFFICIAL:
There is hereby created the position of an enforcement officer to be called the
building official who shall be an employee in the building department and under
the direction of the director of community services. The building official
shall be appointed by the village president with the approval by a majority
vote of the board of trustees. Subject to the provisions of this chapter, the
building official shall have the powers and duties assigned to the position of
building official as set forth in the building code, and any reference therein
to "administrative authority" or "code official" shall refer to the building
official. Any person serving as building official shall have a broad knowledge
of building construction insofar as practical and technical concepts including
the related fields of plumbing, heating, ventilating and electrical
construction. The building official's basic duties shall be as follows:
   A.   Set up, keep and maintain a file of applications, permits issued,
plats, diagrams, plans and other data required by this title to be filed.
   B.   Receive all applications for building permits and approve the issuance
of building permits when the applications comply with the requirements of this
title. Notwithstanding any provision to the contrary that may be contained in
the building code adopted in this title or in other provisions of this title,
no building permit shall be issued or delivered by the building official to any
person unless the permit is countersigned by a member of the building and
zoning committee.
   C.   Receive reports of inspectors of Lake County or recognized inspection
services, after investigation of their qualifications and reliability, in
connection with reviews of commercial projects or code matters beyond the
general competence of the building official, provided such reports shall be
made in writing and certified by a responsible person of such agency or
service.
   D.   Make the necessary practical inspections of work performed in the field
or reasonably ascertain whether all regulations of this title to property,
buildings or structures are complied with.
   E.   Keep a record of all inspections made, of reports rendered and of
notices of orders issued and deposit such records in the individual property
file previously mentioned.
   F.   Upon satisfactory completion of the construction described, the
building official shall, if said construction is in compliance with the terms
of this title, issue a certificate of occupancy and no structure shall be
occupied or used for any purpose prior to the issuance of said certificate.
(Ord. 07-4-6, 4-17-2007)
8-2-3: STAFF REVIEW COMMITTEE:
The staff review committee shall be chaired by the village president and shall
include a member of the building and zoning committee, the director of
community services, the village engineer and the village forester and may
include such other village officials, agents or employees as from time to time
deemed necessary by the village president. The staff review committee shall
perform such functions and have such powers and duties as directed by the
village president with regard to oversight of the building department,
including the following:
   A.   Overseeing the administration and enforcement of this title and
ensuring that all construction activities and development proposals comply with
the standards of this title;
   B.   Conducting preliminary and informational meetings on proposed
developments;
   C.   Conducting preapplication meetings with applicants for the purpose of
preliminary review of proposed text amendments, zoning map amendments, special
use applications, site development plans and subdivision plats and promoting
solutions that will achieve the most desirable site design; and
   D.   Interpreting the requirements of this title as applied to particular
circumstances when such interpretation does not require the approval by the
board of trustees.
The staff review committee will not hold any public hearings or perform the
duties of the plan commission or zoning board of appeals. If a subdivision
plat, text amendment, special use or other matter within the purview of the
plan commission is involved, following any preapplication meetings with the
staff review committee, the applicant will be required to submit an application
to the plan commission in accordance with village ordinances. If a variation
under the zoning ordinance is required, following any preapplication meetings
with the staff review committee, the applicant will be required to submit an
application to the zoning board of appeals in accordance with village
ordinances. (Ord. 07-4-6, 4-17-2007)
8-2-4: PERMIT PROCESS FLOW CHART:
   A.   Step 1: Determine which permits are needed for application, pick up
development handbook and meet with director of community services.
 
Permit Type                        Type Of Project
Building                           Projects of limited scope without grading
                                   may require only a building permit.
                                   More extensive projects with construction
                                   deliveries and staging or involving tree
                                   removal may require a site preparation plan
                                   or tree removal permit, as determined by the
Site preparation; building         director of community services. If a site
                                   preparation plan is required, the site
                                   preparation work under a site preparation
                                   permit must be completed before the building
                                   permit will issue.
                                   Construction involving building and grading
Site preparation; building; site   will require 3 permits: site preparation
development                        permit, building permit and site development
                                   permit.
                                   Grading with no building activity requires a
Site preparation; site development site preparation permit and site development
                                   permit.
 
In all cases where a site preparation plan is required, then all work under the
site preparation permit must be completed before the other permits will issue.
A site preparation permit may also serve as the tree removal permit.
   B.   Step 2: File completed applications, including supplemental permit
applications when required.
      1.   Building permit application requirements are set forth in section
8-4-2 of this title and set forth in further detail in the Development
Handbook. The building official will review such applications.
      2.   Site preparation permit and site development permit application
requirements are set forth in sections
8-3-3 and
8-5-2 of this title and set forth in further detail in the Development
Handbook. The Director of Community Services, Village Engineer and Village
Forester will review such applications. Additional reviews may be required by
the Village's wetland consultant.
      3.   For site preparation permits and site development permits, the
applicant may be required to obtain a wetland survey, tree inventory, woodland
delineation and other data that may be difficult to obtain at certain times of
the year, and the applicant should factor the delays inherent in obtaining such
information into the applicant's intended construction schedule. For example, a
completed site development permit application may be required to include these
supplemental permit applications:
         a.   A completed tree removal permit application form.
         b.   A completed Lake County watershed development ordinance permit
application form.
         c.   A copy of a Lake County wetland inventory map marked to show the
subject property.
Applicants should consult the Development Handbook for all submittal
requirements.
   C.   Step 3A: If no site preparation is required, the applicant posts street
restoration and completion security as required herein, pays permit fees and a
building permit is issued, which must be posted on the property.
   D.   Step 3B: If site preparation is required, the applicant posts street
restoration security as required herein, and then the site preparation permit
will be issued, which must be posted on the property.
   E.   Step 3C: After completing site preparation work, the applicant posts
the required completion security, and then building permit and site development
permit will be issued, both of which must be posted on the property. (Ord. 07-
4-6, 4-17-2007)
CHAPTER 3
SITE MANAGEMENT, SITE PREPARATION PERMITS, STREET RESTORATION SECURITY
SECTION:
8-3-1: Safe Site Management Practices
8-3-2: Site Preparation Plan And Permit
8-3-3: Contents Of Site Preparation Plan
8-3-4: Street Restoration Security
8-3-5: Issuance Of Site Preparation Permit
8-3-6: Displaying Permits, Contact Information And Person In Charge
8-3-1: SAFE SITE MANAGEMENT PRACTICES:
Any permittee engaged in construction for which a site preparation permit,
building permit or site development permit is issued shall keep and observe and
shall cause its contractors, agents and employees to keep and observe the
following requirements:
   A.   All construction and building sites shall be kept and maintained free
and clear of debris and refuse generated by site preparation, construction,
reconstruction or demolition of buildings and structures.
   B.   Construction debris and refuse containment shall be required for all
job sites. Containment shall occur on the property that is the subject of the
permit, and shall be within a dumpster, structure, or container that can be
covered to prevent windblown debris. All such dumpsters, structures, or
containers shall be covered at all times when no work is being performed on the
property that is the subject of the permit.
   C.   When dumpsters are provided they shall be located on private property
and set back so as not to encroach on an interior side yard, as defined by the
Riverwoods zoning ordinance as amended.
   D.   Soil erosion and sediment control measures shall be provided and
maintained as required by the village engineer.
   E.   As required by the state of Illinois plumbing code, in the case of new
construction or major renovation work when existing sanitary facilities are not
yet available, the construction sites shall be provided a portable toilet. The
portable toilet shall be provided not later than immediately after completion
of excavation of the foundation. The location of the portable toilet shall be
set back a minimum of six feet (6') from all property lines. (Ord. 07-4-6, 4-
17-2007)
8-3-2: SITE PREPARATION PLAN AND PERMIT:
The director of community services shall determine whether the scope of a
project for which an applicant seeks a building permit merits the preparation
of a site preparation plan to minimize damage to the land in question as well
as surrounding property (i.e., soil erosion, damage to storm water drainage
routes, culverts, protected trees and surrounding streets) and to maintain an
orderly, secure, safe and clean construction site. If a site preparation plan
is required in circumstances when only a building permit is being applied for,
then the applicant shall apply for a site preparation permit. If a site
preparation plan is required in circumstances when a site development permit is
being applied for, then the applicant shall prepare and submit the site
preparation plan as part of the submittal requirements for the site development
permit. (Ord. 07-4-6, 4-17-2007)
8-3-3: CONTENTS OF SITE PREPARATION PLAN:
A site preparation plan shall include such information as may be required by
the director of community services, village engineer or village forester to
minimize damage to the land in question as well as surrounding property and to
demonstrate safe site construction management, including drawings or narrative
description for one or more of the following categories of site preparation
work to be performed:
   A.   Removal of trees, tree pruning, root pruning, and other tree care
activities that are proposed in the permit application.
   B.   Installation of protective tree fencing. All protective tree fencing
shall be chainlink fence construction with anchored posts and chainlink fabric
meeting such specifications as from time to time required by the director of
community services to establish sturdy and reliable fencing.
   C.   Installation of erosion control measures and construction driveway.
   D.   Installation of perimeter area construction fencing. (Ord. 07-4-6, 4-
17-2007)
   E.   Installation of temporary markers delineating the limits of protected
woodland under the Riverwoods tree and woodland protection ordinance or
permanent "protected area" markers at the boundaries of wetlands, wetland
buffers, or protected areas proposed to remain undisturbed. (Ord. 07-4-6, 4-1-
2007; amd. Ord. 18-03-05, 3-6-2018)
   F.   Abandonment of existing water well or installation of protective
fencing around well that is to remain.
   G.   Shutoff of gas lines or other utilities.
   H.   Location and delivery of portable toilet and trash receptacle.
   I.   Installation of contractor sign meeting the requirements of section
8-3-6 of this chapter.
   J.   If excavation is required for a new structure, foundation, utility
installation or drainage improvement, then the site preparation plan shall
indicate the: 1) installation of a single construction entrance, which may be
in the location of the permanent driveway, from the adjoining public or private
street to the lot and 2) installation of additional fencing in the construction
area so that all construction traffic to and from the construction area uses
the construction driveway. The construction driveway shall be constructed with
three inch (3") crushed limestone to a minimum compacted depth of six inches
(6").
   K.   The site preparation plan shall indicate that, prior to installation of
the construction driveway, the applicant shall be required to install, repair
or replace culverts and ditches so that the natural flow of surface stormwater
on or along the lot is not impeded by the construction driveway or debris and
construction materials. All culverts shall be installed, repaired or replaced
in accordance with the requirements under title 7, chapter 1, "Culverts,
Ditches And Swales", of this Code. The applicant is responsible for securing
all necessary approvals from the Village or other governmental bodies having
jurisdiction before locating its construction driveway. (Ord. 07-4-6, 4-17-
2007)
8-3-4: STREET RESTORATION SECURITY:
Prior to the issuance of any site preparation permit, building permit, or site
development permit, the applicant shall schedule a video and photographic
inspection of the adjoining public or private street to be conducted by the
Building Department, which shall prepare a dated VHS videotape or digital video
disc (DVD) clearly showing the existing condition of all portions of the street
(s), shoulders, parkways, ditches, and culverts along or within one hundred
feet (100') of the property to be developed (i.e., along the entire lot line
adjoining the street and extending from each end of such lot line for a
distance of 100 feet along the public or private street right-of-way beyond the
boundary of the lot), and such VHS videotape or DVD inspection report shall be
admissible as sufficient evidence in any court proceeding or other dispute
between the applicant and the Village concerning the condition of such public
or private street prior to the applicant's activities. Prior to the issuance of
a building permit, site preparation permit, or site development permit, the
applicant shall also deliver to the Village a form of security herein described
(the "street restoration security") to run to the benefit of the Village to
protect the Village and hold it free and harmless from all claims or rights of
action arising from or claimed to be due from the use of said street, and for
the further purpose of guaranteeing the restoration of such street or streets
in the event of any damage or injury caused by such construction vehicles. The
street restoration security shall consist of either: a) a refundable cash
deposit or b) an irrevocable, unconditional letter of credit in a form
satisfactory to the Village. A permit applicant applying for a building permit
and site development permit for the same construction project (i.e.,
construction or remodeling of a single-family residence) shall be required to
deliver only one street restoration security. The street restoration security
may be posted by the owner of the property or the owner's contractor, as the
permit applicant, but in any event only one street restoration security shall
be required for a single construction project. A permit applicant applying for
permits for different construction projects on the same street shall be
required to furnish one street restoration security for each construction
project. The amount of the street restoration security shall be the greater of:
a) two thousand dollars ($2,000.00) or b) an amount based on a sliding scale
related to the estimated cost of construction provided in the permit
application, as follows:
 
Estimated Cost Of Construction Street Restoration Security
$0.00 to $625,000.00           4 percent of cost
Over $625,000.00               $25,000.00 plus 3 percent of cost over
                               $650,000.00
 
The return of the cash deposit or letter of credit shall be conditioned upon
the faithful performance of the conditions and provisions of the permits, the
plans accompanying such permits and other applicable provisions of this Code.
If there shall be any damage to the public or private street used during the
applicant's construction, based upon a comparison of the video and photographic
inspection conducted by the building department, then the applicant's
activities shall be presumed to be the primary cause of such damage and the
village may use the street restoration security to restore the condition of the
damaged street. In case of any unresolved dispute or suit by or among the
owners of any privately owned street, to which the village is or at any time
may become a party, regarding the street restoration security or the repairs
made or to be made to such damaged private street, the village shall be
authorized to comply with any and all orders, judgments or decrees entered or
issued by any court with or without jurisdiction, and the village shall have
the right to file an action in the nature of an interpleader and deposit the
street restoration security with any such court, and the village shall have a
lien on the street restoration security for any and all attorney fees, expert
witness fees, court costs, and any other expenses the village may have incurred
or become liable for on account of the holding of the street restoration
security or using the proceeds thereof for repairing the damaged street. (Ord.
07-4-6, 4-17-2007)
8-3-5: ISSUANCE OF SITE PREPARATION PERMIT:
If the objectives of minimizing damage to the land in question as well as
surrounding property and all requirements relating to safe site construction
management are demonstrated in the site preparation plan, and if the required
street restoration security is posted, and if all other requirements are
satisfied for the issuance of a building permit or site development permit in
accordance with this title, then the director of community service shall
indicate his approval of the site preparation plan by signing and issuing a
site preparation permit to the applicant. Under the site preparation permit,
the applicant shall perform the work indicated in the site preparation plan and
shall not perform any work for which a building permit or site development
permit must separately be issued. (Ord. 07-4-6, 4-17-2007)
8-3-6: DISPLAYING PERMITS, CONTACT INFORMATION AND PERSON IN CHARGE:
When any site preparation permit, building permit or site development permit is
issued for any parcel, such permits, including the complete plans for all work
approved by such permits bearing the stamp of approval of the village, shall be
maintained at the site during the progress of the work. Until the final
inspection is made, the permit cards and a construction sign shall be displayed
on the perimeter area construction fencing or elsewhere as approved by the
director of community services setting forth the following: the name of the
contractor, name of the "person in charge", an emergency telephone number or
pager that is always answered so that the contractor can be reached, and the
hours and days of the week when construction work is permitted to take place on
the site. The person in charge shall be that individual who is responsible for
all construction operations on the site, including maintenance of protective
fencing and erosion control measures, containment of construction debris, and
scheduling of village inspections. The person in charge shall ensure that all
contractors and subcontractors working on this project are supplied with copies
of the approved plans as necessary. The person in charge shall be the sole
point of contact for all correspondence or direction from the village. The
person in charge shall have at the project at all times, as the owner's agent,
a competent English speaking superintendent capable of reading and thoroughly
understanding the approved plans and thoroughly experienced in the type of work
being performed, who shall receive instructions from the building official or
authorized representatives. The person in charge shall have full authority to
execute orders or directions of the building official without delay, and to
promptly supply such materials, equipment, tools, labor, and incidentals as may
be required. (Ord. 07-4-6, 4-17-2007)
CHAPTER 4
BUILDING PERMITS
SECTION:
8-4-1: Building Permit Required
8-4-2: Application For Building Permit
8-4-3: Issuance Of Building Permit
8-4-4: Alterations In Plans
8-4-5: Inspections And Stop Work Orders
8-4-6: Permit Fees
8-4-7: Time Limit On Permits; Extension Fees
8-4-8: Completion Security For Construction
8-4-9: Certificates Of Occupancy
8-4-1: BUILDING PERMIT REQUIRED:
No person shall construct, alter, repair, wreck or move any building, structure
or part thereof or perform any work regulated by the building code in violation
of the provisions of the building code or any other provisions of this title.
It shall be unlawful to vary from the terms of any building permit, including
the plans and specifications relative thereto, in connection with any such
work; provided that a building permit may be amended upon proper application as
provided herein. In all cases where a building permit is required under the
building code, no person shall construct, alter, repair, wreck or move any
building, structure or part thereof or perform any work regulated by the
building code without first obtaining a building permit for such work approved
by the building official. Without limiting the instances in which building
permits are required under the building code, the following examples of work
require building permits:
   A.   Single-family residential, office, institutional or commercial
construction;
   B.   All additions or modifications to existing buildings or structures,
including single-family residential additions;
   C.   Additions and enlargements to garages and barns;
   D.   Modifications or changes to existing structures requiring major
interior structural changes;
   E.   All major modifications to electrical or plumbing or heating or other
utilities;
   F.   All modifications to swimming pools or other recreational structures
with major architectural features;
   G.   Replacement or major modifications of plumbing facilities (within the
structure);
   H.   Replacement or major modifications of plumbing facilities (outside of
premises such as septic tanks and drainage fields);
   I.   Replacement or major modifications of water supply wells and
distribution facilities;
   J.   Replacement or major modifications of oil fired heating facilities;
   K.   Replacement or major modifications of gas fired heating facilities; and
   L.   Replacement or major modifications of electrical wiring and other
electrical facilities. (Ord. 07-4-6, 4-17-2007)
8-4-2: APPLICATION FOR BUILDING PERMIT:
Application for a building permit shall be made by the owner or his agent to
the village by filing with the building department, on application forms
devised and supplied by the building official, the following:
   A.   A copy of the building permit application with all the information
requested thereon and signed by the owner or authorized agent.
   B.   A copy of a "plat of survey" certified by a duly licensed Illinois land
surveyor. In addition to the mandatory information required on such certified
plat there shall be the surveyor's statement as to the area in square feet
contained in the tract represented on said plat exclusive of all easements for
ingress or egress. There shall also be superimposed on said plat an outline to
scale of all structures present and proposed with dimensions to indicate their
exact location on the tract of land with relation to the boundary lines of said
tract. The structures referred to shall include walls, septic tanks and septic
drainage fields, and other underground utilities. This survey is to be retained
by the village as part of a permanent record.
   C.   Three (3) copies of complete plans of the proposed structure drawn to a
scale, no smaller than one-fourth inch equal to one foot (1/4" = 1') with all
dimensions figured accurately. The plans and specifications shall be
sufficiently explicit and complete so that the proposed structure can be
constructed therefrom by any competent contractor, builder or engineer without
further direction. In addition the plans shall indicate the enclosed area in
square feet of floor space and the net volume of the structure in cubic feet.
   D.   All plans, computations and specifications required for a building
permit application for new construction work, alteration, repair, expansion,
addition or modification work involving the practice of professional
architecture or engineering, as defined by the laws of the state, shall be
prepared by, or under the supervision of, and signed and sealed by a
professional architect or engineer.
   E.   Excepting that an owner may design, draw plans and supervise
construction of any building, structure or part thereof to be constructed on
his parcel, specifically for his own use and occupancy and provided all
provisions of this title and any other provision that may apply to the proposed
work shall have been complied with and provided further that this exception
shall only apply to the owner's use and occupancy of a single parcel of land at
any one time and for no longer than a two (2) year duration, the following
certificate shall appear on all sheets of plans submitted for approval:
      Designed and drawn by              (signature)                        
(dated)
   F.   In any case when a site development permit is required under this
title, the application for a building permit must be accompanied by an
application for a site development permit, and all requirements for applying
for a site development permit must be satisfied prior to or concurrently with
the review and approval of any building permit.
   G.   The applicant shall submit a site preparation plan, unless waived by
the director of community services for projects of limited scope. (Ord. 07-4-6,
4-17-2007)
8-4-3: ISSUANCE OF BUILDING PERMIT:
   A.   The approval of applications and issuance of building permits shall be
the duty of the building official and then only after proof of knowledge of
regulations and building code adopted in this title, along with proof of
competency to do the work under the direction, supervision and responsibility
of a duly registered person authorized under the laws of the state of Illinois
to make such installations and alterations, has been made to the satisfaction
of the building official.
   B.   If the building official finds that all relevant provisions of this
title have been complied with, he shall indicate his approval of the building
permit application by signing the building permit and directing the applicant
to deposit the applicable permit fee and completion security with the building
department, provided that in any case when a site development permit is
required under this title, the building official shall not approve issuance of
a building permit until all requirements for obtaining a site development
permit are satisfied.
   C.   If the building official has approved the issuance of a building
permit, then the director of community services shall proceed to consider the
issuance of a site preparation permit under section
8-3-2 of this title, if one is required.
   D.   When the director of community services determines that:
      1.   The work to be performed under the site preparation permit, if one
is required, has been properly completed (for which work he shall schedule
inspections of the site by the village engineer and village forester) and
street restoration security properly posted; and
      2.   The completion security required under section
8-4-8, "Completion Security For Construction", of this chapter has been
provided,
he shall so inform the building official who shall then be authorized to
release the building permit to the applicant. (Ord. 07-4-6, 4-17-2007)
8-4-4: ALTERATIONS IN PLANS:
Alterations in the plans and specifications submitted for a building permit
shall be made only after the issuance of an amended permit issued in the same
manner as an original permit except that the fees required shall not be charged
except insofar as said alterations would have increased the original permit
fees. No amended permit issued shall be valid unless signed by the building
official. (Ord. 07-4-6, 4-17-2007)
8-4-5: INSPECTIONS AND STOP WORK ORDERS:
   A.   Subject to all applicable provisions and protections contained in and
afforded by the United States and Illinois constitutions, and other applicable
laws or regulations, the building official shall have the power to make or
cause to be made entry into any building or premises in the village at any
reasonable hour for the purpose of making inspections where the work of
constructing, altering or repairing any building or structure is in process; or
where any plumbing or electric work is being installed, altered or repaired.
The building official, after due notice, shall have the power to order all
construction, alteration or repair work to be stopped in any building or
premises in the village when such work is being done in violation of any
provision of this title or other village ordinances, provided that if the stop
order is an oral one, it shall be followed by a written stop order within
twenty four (24) hours. Such written stop order shall be served personally or
by certified mail, return receipt requested. All work thus stopped shall not be
resumed except if the conditions are remedied or violation eliminated and
written permission to resume work from the building official is granted.
   B.   The failure to comply with or the unauthorized removal or defacing of a
stop order or continuing to work in violation of a stop order issued pursuant
to this section shall constitute an offense. (Ord. 07-4-6, 4-17-2007)
8-4-6: PERMIT FEES:
Permit and inspection fees shall be as set forth in fee schedules to be adopted
from time to time by the board of trustees pursuant to section
1-11-5 of this code. Before any work is started, the constructor or permittee
shall pay to the village clerk the permit and inspection fees for the work
covered by the building permit as specified in the fee schedule. No building
permit or amendment to a building permit shall be issued until the fees
prescribed for such permits are paid. If, in the opinion of the building
official, any applicant for a permit has provided with his application an
incorrect estimate of the cost of the work to be performed thereunder, the
building official shall make a correct estimate of the cost of the work and
adjust the permit fee based on the annual fee schedule. The applicant shall pay
any increased permit fee, which may be due upon written demand from the
building official. (Ord. 07-4-6, 4-17-2007)
8-4-7: TIME LIMIT ON PERMITS; EXTENSION FEES:
Building permits shall have the time limits set forth in the building code;
however, they may be extended for a like period after payment of ten percent
(10%) of the original permit charge and provided that only one such extension
is permitted. (Ord. 07-4-6, 4-17-2007)
8-4-8: COMPLETION SECURITY FOR CONSTRUCTION:
   A.   Before commencing work for which a building permit is required, the
person obtaining the building permit shall deposit an irrevocable,
unconditional letter of credit issued by a national bank or Illinois state bank
with an office in the Chicago metropolitan area or make a cash deposit with the
village. The amount of the letter of credit or cash deposit shall be determined
according to the fee schedule adopted from time to time by the board of
trustees pursuant to section
1-11-5 of this code.
   B.   The deposit shall be held by the village until such a time as full
occupancy approval is granted by the building official. If all provisions of
governing ordinances of the village are met, the total amount of deposit
exclusive of any interest earned shall be returned to the permittee. In the
event of permit expiration, the building official or his agent may at their
discretion draw down and retain funds from the completion security to renew
said permit (see section
8-4-7, "Time Limit On Permits; Extension Fees", of this chapter), with the
balance refundable upon full occupancy approval. The permittee may be required
to post an additional amount, which will maintain his continuing completion
bond deposit.
   C.   If the permittee fails to perform the work in accordance with this
title and the conditions of the building permit, the building official shall
recommend to the board of trustees, and the board of trustees shall decide
whether to draw down and retain funds from the completion security to remedy
any violation. (Ord. 07-4-6, 4-17-2007)
8-4-9: CERTIFICATES OF OCCUPANCY:
   A.   No certificate of occupancy, as required under the Riverwoods zoning
code, shall be issued for the occupancy of any building constructed or altered
after the adoption of this title unless the building has been constructed or
altered in compliance with the provisions of this title. Upon making final
inspection of any construction work for which a permit is required, the
building official may execute a document indicating that such final inspection
has been made and that he has found no known violation of the provisions of
this title in connection therewith, but such document shall not be construed to
be a certificate or statement that the work has been done properly or that it
has been done in accordance with private agreements or contracts.
   B.   In addition to the certificate of compliance with the provisions of
this title, the certificate of occupancy shall state the purposes for which the
building may be used in its several parts, and all special stipulations of the
permit, if any.
   C.   Upon request of the holder of a building permit, the building official
may issue a temporary certificate of occupancy for complete or partial
occupancy of a building or structure; providing the interior of the building on
the premises complies with the requirements of this title and such temporary
occupancy or use can be safely undertaken and will not jeopardize life or
property and the only remaining work under the building permit to be performed
consists of exterior landscaping. Such temporary certificates of occupancy
shall be issued for a period expiring on next following May 15, by which time
all exterior landscaping shall be installed, unless a further extension for
good cause shown is granted by the building official. To obtain a temporary
certificate of occupancy, the holder of a building permit must:
      1.   Sign a written agreement with the village stipulating remaining work
to be done and/or deficiencies, which must be corrected. Such agreement may
contain additional stipulations as may from time to time be deemed in the best
interest of the village by the building official. Such agreement shall be
cosigned by the owner, contract purchaser or the tenant;
      2.   Post an additional cash deposit or irrevocable letter of credit
acceptable to the village in an amount equivalent to the cost of completing
and/or remedying all items stipulated in the agreement as recommended by the
village forester; providing, however, that such amount shall not be less than
one thousand dollars ($1,000.00).
Failure by the holder of a temporary certificate of occupancy to obtain a final
certificate of occupancy by the date established by the building official shall
result in automatic forfeiture of the related cash deposit or irrevocable
letter of credit. The building official shall use such forfeited funds to
complete the work indicated on the inspection report attached to the temporary
certificate of occupancy, which was issued for the premises. Such forfeiture
shall not impair the right of the village to enforce any and all remedies
available to it by reason of any violation, including the right to recover a
fine or penalty or seek injunctive relief. Any balance remaining in the cash
deposit or irrevocable letter of credit not required to complete the work shall
be refunded to the depositor.
   D.   A certificate of occupancy shall be issued within five (5) working days
after written application therefor, if the building at the time of such
application meets the requirements therefor. If the building does not meet the
requirements, the building official shall inform the applicant within five (5)
working days of the specific deficiencies on which the denial of a certificate
of occupancy is based, citing particular provisions of the adopted codes and
ordinances of the village with respect to which compliance is lacking.
   E.   No certificate of occupancy shall be issued for any new use or change
in use of a building or structure or portion thereof unless such building or
structure or portion thereof meets the standards for such use as required by
this chapter. The use of a building or premises shall not be deemed to have
changed because of a temporary vacancy or change of ownership or tenancy. The
reestablishment in a building, after a change of occupancy has been made, of a
prior use that would not have been permitted in a new building of the same type
of construction is prohibited.
   F.   No plumbing, heating, ventilating, air conditioning or electrical work,
except as otherwise provided hereinafter, for which a permit is required shall
be used in whole or in part until a certificate of compliance has been issued
by the building official stating that all work has been done in accordance with
the requirements of this title and other applicable laws, codes and ordinances.
(Ord. 07-4-6, 4-17-2007)
CHAPTER 5
SITE DEVELOPMENT PERMITS
SECTION:
8-5-1: Site Development Permit Required
8-5-2: Application For Site Development Permit
8-5-3: Issuance Of Site Development Permit
8-5-4: Inspections And Stop Work Orders
8-5-5: Scheduled Inspections; Certificate Of Completion
8-5-6: No Liability For Inspections
8-5-7: Permit Fees
8-5-8: Escrow Fees
8-5-9: Completion Security
8-5-10: Expiration Of Permit
8-5-11: Revocation Of Permit
8-5-12: Exceptions
8-5-13: Appeals
8-5-14: Nuisances Not Excused
8-5-1: SITE DEVELOPMENT PERMIT REQUIRED:
No person shall perform any site development work on any parcel or part thereof
without first obtaining a site development permit, unless the scope of work
involved is fully authorized by a tree removal permit under the Riverwoods tree
and woodland protection ordinance. (Ord. 07-4-6, 4-17-2007; amd. Ord. 18-03-05,
3-6-2018)
8-5-2: APPLICATION FOR SITE DEVELOPMENT PERMIT:
   A.   Application for a site development permit shall be made in writing to
the Building Department by the owner of record or his authorized agent and
submitted on forms furnished by the Director of Community Services for that
purpose, together with all other items specified in a site development permit
application checklist. The Director of Community Services may from time to time
update and revise the requirements of the site development permit application.
At a minimum, the application shall contain the following items to the extent
applicable and indicate whether each relevant item on the site development
permit application checklist has been furnished: (Ord. 07-4-6, 4-17-2007)
      1.   A completed tree removal permit application (if necessary for
purposes of the Riverwoods tree and woodland protection ordinance).
      2.   A tree inventory and survey delineating the extent of any protected
woodland (if necessary for purposes of the Riverwoods tree and woodland
protection ordinance) prepared by a professional landscape consultant. (Ord.
07-4-6, 4-17-2007; amd. Ord. 18-03-05, 3-6-2018)
      3.   A completed watershed development permit application (if necessary
for purposes of the Lake County watershed development ordinance).
      4.   A copy of the Lake County wetland inventory map as furnished by the
Village to the applicant on which the applicant shall indicate the subject
property.
      5.   A copy of the special flood hazard area map as furnished by the
Village to the applicant on which the applicant shall indicate the subject
property.
      6.   A copy of the zoning map of the Village as furnished by the Village
to the applicant and on which the applicant shall indicate the subject
property.
      7.   A site development plan prepared by a professional engineer on
behalf of the applicant in accordance with the detailed provisions of the
Development Handbook.
      8.   Architectural drawings.
      9.   The elements of a site preparation plan as described in section
8-3-3 of this title, unless waived by the Director of Community Services for
projects of limited scope and impact on adjoining properties, shall be included
in the site development plan drawings.
      10.   A completed site development permit application checklist.
   B.   The Director of Community Services, with the assistance of the Village
Engineer and Village Forester, shall prepare the requirements for the contents
of a site development plan and other submissions required for a site
development permit and shall cause such requirements to be assembled and made
available to the public as the site development handbook of the village. Such
requirements shall be devised for the purpose of specifying the detailed
information and data which are necessary for evaluating applications for site
development permits under the relevant ordinances and regulations of the
village. All plans, drawings, computations and specifications required for a
site development permit application shall be prepared by, or under the
supervision of, and signed and sealed by a professional architect, engineer or
landscape consultant, as appropriate. (Ord. 07-4-6, 4-17-2007)
8-5-3: ISSUANCE OF SITE DEVELOPMENT PERMIT:
   A.   The review and recommendation for approval of site development permit
applications and issuance of site development permits shall be the duty of the
director of community services with the concurrence of the village engineer and
village forester under the direction of the staff review committee and then
only after the applicant has demonstrated proof of knowledge of regulations
adopted in this title, along with proof of competency to do the work or to
cause the work to be performed under the direction, supervision and
responsibility of a professional engineer or landscape consultant, as
applicable. The staff review committee may direct that the applicant meet with
the committee to clarify any proposed work and to consider alternatives.
   B.   If the director of community services, the village engineer and village
forester find that all relevant provisions of this title have been complied
with, including any conditions that may have been established by the staff
review committee, they shall each indicate approval of the site development
permit application by signing the site development permit.
   C.   When the director of community services determines that:
      1.   The work to be performed under the site preparation permit, if one
is required, has been properly completed (for which work he shall schedule
inspections of the site by the village engineer and village forester) and
street restoration security properly posted; and
      2.   The completion security required under section
8-5-9, "Completion Security", of this chapter has been provided,
then he shall be authorized to release the site development permit to the
applicant. (Ord. 07-4-6, 4-17-2007)
8-5-4: INSPECTIONS AND STOP WORK ORDERS:
   A.   Subject to all applicable provisions and protections contained in and
afforded by the United States and Illinois constitutions, and other applicable
laws or regulations, when any site development work is being performed, the
director of community services, village engineer or village forester shall each
have the power to make or cause to be made entry onto any lot or parcel in the
village at any reasonable hour for the purpose of making inspections where site
development work is in process. The director of community services, village
engineer or village forester shall each have the power to order all site
development work to be stopped on any parcel when such work is being done in
violation of any provision of this title or other village ordinances, provided
that if the stop order is an oral one, it shall be followed by a written stop
order within twenty four (24) hours. Such written stop order shall be served
personally or by certified mail, return receipt requested. All work thus
stopped shall not be resumed except if the conditions are remedied or violation
eliminated and written permission to resume work from the director of community
services is granted.
   B.   The failure to comply with or the unauthorized removal or defacing of a
stop order or continuing to work in violation of a stop order issued pursuant
to this section shall constitute an offense. (Ord. 07-4-6, 4-17-2007)
8-5-5: SCHEDULED INSPECTIONS; CERTIFICATE OF COMPLETION:
   A.   In order to obtain the inspections required by this section, in
accordance with the following schedule, the permittee shall notify the village
at least two (2) full working days before said inspection is to be made:
      1.   Site Preparation: When all work under the required site preparation
permit has been completed.
      2.   Rough Grading: When all rough grading has been completed.
      3.   Final Inspection: When all work, including installation of all
drainage, other structures and required planting, has been completed, ground
cover has been established and an as built survey has been prepared for
projects of more than limited scope (as required by the village engineer) to
show site development work as finally installed.
   B.   If upon inspection of any site development work, it is found that the
work authorized by the site development permit has been completed in accordance
with the requirements of the permit and this chapter, the director of community
services shall obtain the recommendation of the village engineer or village
forester, as applicable, for the reduction or return of any bonds or other
security previously posted by the permittee with the village, and the director
of community services shall certify that such work has, to the best of his
knowledge, been satisfactorily performed, subject to any continuing maintenance
and repair obligations. Such certificate of completion shall be placed in the
property file for the parcel. (Ord. 07-4-6, 4-17-2007)
8-5-6: NO LIABILITY FOR INSPECTIONS:
Failure of any village officials to observe or recognize hazardous or scarring
conditions which may adversely affect the economic value of the site or other
property in the vicinity, or to recommend denial of a site development permit,
shall not relieve the permittee of responsibility for the condition or damages
resulting therefrom, and shall not result in the village, its officers or
agents being responsible for the conditions or damages resulting therefrom.
(Ord. 07-4-6, 4-17-2007)
8-5-7: PERMIT FEES:
Permit and inspection fees shall be as set forth in the fee schedule to be
adopted from time to time by the board of trustees pursuant to section
1-11-5 of this code. Before any work is started, the constructor or permittee
shall pay to the village clerk the permit and inspection fees for the work
covered by the site development permit as specified in the fee schedule. (Ord.
07-4-6, 4-17-2007)
8-5-8: ESCROW FEES:
To defray the fees and expenses of the village's independent consultants
incurred for the review of an applicant's site development permit application,
the director of community services shall require the applicant to make a cash
deposit with the village clerk to be held and applied for such purpose only.
The amount of escrow shall be based as set forth in the village's fee schedule.
(Ord. 07-4-6, 4-17-2007)
8-5-9: COMPLETION SECURITY:
   A.   Required: Before issuance of a permit, the applicant shall be required
to post an irrevocable, unconditional letter of credit or refundable cash
deposit with the village in a form satisfactory to the village, such completion
security to be to the benefit of the village. Such completion security shall be
a minimum of one thousand five hundred dollars ($1,500.00) or an amount deemed
by the village in cooperation with its consulting agents and officers to be
sufficient to cover cost of improvements shown on the site development plan
including the landscape installation and its maintenance for such period of
time as may be specified by the village, engineering, inspection fees, and all
incidental expenses. The term of the completion security shall commence on the
date the application is granted and remain in full force and effect until
completion of the work to the satisfaction of the village. In the event the
village shall have to complete the work specified in the application, the
completion security may be drawn upon and applied for the payment of all
necessary costs and expenses incurred until completion of the work to the
satisfaction of the village. Where the security has been in the form of a cash
deposit, said deposit or any unused portion thereof shall be refunded to the
permittee upon certification of satisfactory completion by the village. In the
event that all work subject to such completion security has not been completed,
the village may utilize any of the completion security for the purpose of
completing work required regardless of the purpose for which the completion
security was originally provided.
   B.   Liability Insurance: The village shall require that the applicant
furnish evidence satisfactory to the village that he carries public liability
and property damage insurance in the amount of one hundred thousand dollars
($100,000.00), naming and holding harmless the village, its elective and
appointive boards, commissions, officers, agents and employees as additional
insureds to cover claims which may arise out of performance of the work by the
applicant. (Ord. 07-4-6, 4-17-2007)
8-5-10: EXPIRATION OF PERMIT:
Every site development permit shall expire by limitation and become null and
void if the work authorized by such permit has not been commenced within one
hundred eighty (180) days, or is not completed within one year from date of
issue unless the time shall be specified on the permit, except that the
director of community services may, if the permit holder presents satisfactory
evidence that unusual difficulties have prevented work being started or
completed within the specified time limits, grant a reasonable extension of
time if written application is made before the expiration date of the permit.
(Ord. 07-4-6, 4-17-2007)
8-5-11: REVOCATION OF PERMIT:
   A.   Authority: In the event any person holding a site development permit
violates the terms of the permit or conducts or permits to be conducted on said
site development any act which adversely affects the health, welfare or safety
of persons residing or working in the neighborhood of the property of said
permittee or if any permittee conducts or permits to be conducted on said site
development any act which is detrimental to the public welfare or injurious to
property or improvements in the neighborhood, the building official shall
temporarily suspend the site development permit.
   B.   Procedure For Permanently Revoking Permit: No site development permit
shall be permanently revoked or suspended until a hearing is held by the
village board of trustees. Written notice of such hearing shall be served upon
the permittee, either personally or by certified mail, and shall state:
      1.   The grounds for complaint or reasons for the revocation or
suspension in clear and concise language.
      2.   The time when, and the place where such hearing is to be held. Such
notice shall be served by certified mail or personal service on the permittee
at least five (5) days prior to the date set for the hearing. At any such
hearing the permittee shall be given an opportunity to be heard, and he may
call witnesses and present evidence on his behalf. Upon conclusion of such
hearing the board of trustees shall determine whether or not the permit shall
be permanently suspended or revoked.
      3.   The board of trustees shall hold the hearing to consider
recommendations for revocation or suspension of permits that have been
temporarily suspended at the next regularly scheduled meeting of the board of
trustees at which all conditions of subsection B2 of this section can be
fulfilled. (Ord. 07-4-6, 4-17-2007)
8-5-12: EXCEPTIONS:
The village board may authorize exceptions to any of the requirements and
regulations set forth in this chapter. Application for any exception shall be
made by stating fully the grounds of the application and shall be filed with
the site development permit application. In order for the land referred to in
the application to come within the provisions of this section, it shall be
necessary that the village board of trustees find all of the following facts
with respect thereto:
   A.   The land is of such shape or size or is affected by such physical
conditions or is subject to such title limitations of record that it is
impossible or impractical for the applicant to comply with all of the
regulations of this chapter.
   B.   The granting of the exception will not be detrimental to the public
welfare or injurious to other property in the vicinity of the subject property.
After public hearing thereon, the village board, by resolution, may approve the
site development permit application with the exceptions and conditions it deems
necessary or it may disapprove such site development permit application and
exception application or it may take such other action as is appropriate. (Ord.
07-4-6, 4-17-2007)
8-5-13: APPEALS:
The applicant, as well as any person who has received notice of the filing of
the application for a site development permit, may appeal the decision of the
village including any approval resulting from lack of action by the village to
the zoning board of appeals. Upon receipt of an appeal, the zoning board of
appeals shall schedule and hold a public hearing, after giving fifteen (15)
days' notice thereof. The zoning board of appeals shall render a decision
within thirty (30) days of the hearing. Factors to be considered on review
shall include, but not be limited to, possible saturation of fill and
unsupported cuts by water, both natural and domestic; runoff surface waters
that produce erosion, and silting of drainageways; nature and type of soil or
rock that when disturbed by the proposed grading may create earth movement and
produce slopes that cannot be landscaped, and excessive and unnecessary
scarring of the natural landscape through grading or removal of vegetation.
(Ord. 07-4-6, 4-17-2007)
8-5-14: NUISANCES NOT EXCUSED:
The provisions of this chapter shall not be construed as authorizing any
persons to maintain a private or public nuisance upon their property and
compliance with the provisions of this chapter shall not be a defense in any
action to abate such nuisance. (Ord. 07-4-6, 4-17-2007)
CHAPTER 6
PENALTY AND ENFORCEMENT
SECTION:
8-6-1: Violation
8-6-2: Injunctive Relief
8-6-1: VIOLATION:
Any person who violates or refuses to comply with any provisions of this title,
including any of the published codes herein adopted, or constructs, alters,
repairs, demolishes or moves a building, structure or part thereof or performs
or causes to be performed any site development work without the appropriate
building permit or site development permit, as the case may be, or in violation
of any such permits issued pursuant to this title shall be deemed guilty of a
separate offense for each and every day or portion thereof during which any
violation of any of the provisions of this title is committed, continued or
permitted, and upon conviction of any such violation such person shall be
punished by a fine of not more than seven hundred fifty dollars ($750.00) for
each offense. The owner of a structure or premises or parcel where anything in
violation of this title shall be placed or exist and any architect, builder,
contractor, agent, person, firm or corporation that may have assisted in the
commission of such violation shall each be guilty of a separate offense and
upon conviction thereof shall be penalized as above provided. (Ord. 07-4-6, 4-
17-2007)
This section does not apply to licensed plumbers or registered plumbing
contractors inasmuch as violations of the Illinois plumbing code will be
prosecuted by the state of Illinois as authorized by law. (Ord. 15-11-18, 11-
17-2015)
8-6-2: INJUNCTIVE RELIEF:
The imposition of penalties herein prescribed shall in no way preclude the
village from instituting an appropriate action or proceeding to prevent any
unlawful construction, alteration, repair, conversion, maintenance, use,
grading, excavation, filling or site development work or to restrain, correct
or abate a violation or to prevent the occupancy or illegal use of any
structure or premises. (Ord. 07-4-6, 4-17-2007)

herein, subject to the deletions, modifications and amendments set out in this
chapter:

2023 edition.

8-7-2: AMENDMENTS TO THE 2024 INTERNATIONAL BUILDING CODE:
The following sections of the 2024 International Building Code are hereby
added, amended, revised, and changed as follows:
   General Amendments
   The following sections of the 2024 International Building Code are hereby
added, amended, revised, and changed as follows:
   Wherever the phrase "[name of jurisdiction]" or the word "jurisdiction"
appear, they shall refer to the Village of Riverwoods.
   Wherever the phrase "Code Official" or "Department of Building Inspection"
appears, it shall refer to the Village of Riverwoods, Director of Community
Services or his designated agent(s).
   Whenever there is a reference to the "Village of Riverwoods Schedule" or any
other general reference to fees or charges, it shall mean the then-current
ordinance of the Village setting forth fees, charges, and other costs payable
to the Village relating to activities covered by, and the administration of,
this Code. To the extent that fees are set forth in this Chapter that are
different than the then-current ordinance of the Village setting forth fees,
charges, and other costs payable to the Village relating to activities covered
by, and the administration of, this Code, the fees set forth in the then-
current ordinance of the Village setting forth fees, charges, and other costs
shall control.
   Specific Code Amendments
   The following sections of the 2024 International Building Code are hereby
added, amended, revised, and changed as follows:
   Section 101.4.3 Plumbing. Delete the wording "The provision of the
International Plumbing Code" and insert the following language: "The provisions
of the Illinois State Plumbing Code".
   Section 102.2 Other laws. Add "Nothing herein contained shall be deemed to
nullify any provisions of the zoning law or any other statute of the Village
pertaining to the location, use, or type of construction of buildings, except
as may be specifically required by the provisions of this Code".
   Section 102.4.3 Insert "Where a conflict exists between the provisions of
the Code, the provisions of the Fire District requirements or the Referenced
Standards, the stricter requirement shall apply".
   Section 102.7 Other Regulations. Add new Section "When the provisions herein
specified for health, safety, and welfare are more restrictive than other
regulations, this Code shall control".
   Section 103.1 Creation of Enforcement Agency. Delete this section and
replace with "The Director of Community Services shall be known as the building
official".
   Section 103.3 Deputies. Add the following at the end of this section "Any
reference to the Fire Official shall be to the Lincolnshire-Riverwoods Fire
Protection District or Deerfield- Bannockburn Fire Protection District.
   Section 103.4 Effective date of this Code: "The effective date of this Code
shall be February 1, 2025".
   Subsection 105.1.1. Delete.
   Subsection 105.1.2. Delete.
   Section 105.5 Expiration. Delete and replace with "Permits for new
construction of primary buildings are valid for 18 months. All other permits
are valid for 12 months. Permits shall be renewed only one time, valid for 6
months"
   Section 109.2 Schedule of Permit Fees. Insert "The permit fees required by
this Code shall be paid to the Village Clerk or the Clerk's duly authorized
agent for which the permit card shall be issued. No permit shall be valid until
such fees are paid. See the Village Fee Schedule".
   Section 109.7. Professional Consultant Services. Insert new "Plans and
supporting documents shall not be reviewed by Village Consultants until the
appropriate fees have been paid as set forth in the Village Fee Schedule".
   Insert new Subsection 109.7.1 Liability for Property Damage. The Village
shall deduct from the security deposit the cost to correct any damage to
private or public properties which is directly related to the construction for
which the permit has been issued.
   Section 111.3 Temporary Occupancy. Insert at the end "Temporary certificates
of occupancy are valid for 120 days. A security deposit is required as set
forth in the Village Fee Schedule". Building permits shall not expire during
temporary occupancies.
   Section 113.1 General. Delete and replace with “Application For Appeal: "Any
person shall have the right to appeal a decision of the building official to
the zoning board of appeals. An application for appeal shall be based on a
claim that the true intent of this code or the rules legally adopted there
under have been incorrectly interpreted, the provisions of this code do not
fully apply, or an equivalent form of construction is to be used".
   Section 113.2 Limitations on Authority. Delete and replace with
“Disqualification Of Member: A member shall not hear an appeal in which that
member has any personal, professional or financial interest".
   Section 113.3 Qualifications. Delete and replace with “Compensation Of
Members: Compensation of members shall be determined by law".
   Section 113.4 Delete and replace with “Notice Of Meeting: An appeal must be
filed with the zoning board of appeals within 30 days after the date of the
building official's decision thereon".
   Section 113.5 Insert “Open Hearing: All hearings before the board of appeals
shall be open to the public. The appellant, the appellant's representative, the
building official and any person whose interests are affected shall be given an
opportunity to be heard".
   Section 113.6 Insert “Procedure: The zoning board of appeals shall adopt and
make available to the public through the secretary, procedures under which a
hearing will be conducted. The procedures shall not require compliance with
strict rules of evidence but shall mandate that only relevant information is
received”.
   Section 113.7 Insert “Administration: All decisions of the zoning board
hereunder shall be reduced to writing and mailed to the appealing party and the
building official. The building official shall take immediate action in
accordance with the decision of the zoning board of appeals".
   Section 114.4 Violation penalties. Delete "penalties as prescribed by law"
and insert the words "penalties as set forth within the Village Code”.
   Section 116.1.1 Insert “Unsafe Structures and Equipment. Boarding up a
vacant or unsafe structure is considered a temporary measure until a decision
is made as to what remedy the owner wants to pursue as provided in this
section, but in no case can a building be boarded up for more than six (6)
months”.
   Section 1103.1 Where required. Insert new "The State of Illinois
Accessibility Code shall control the design and construction of buildings and
facilities for accessibility and use by physically disabled persons. When there
is a conflict between the Illinois Accessibility Code and the accessibility
requirements in the International Building Code, the stricter shall apply".
   Section 1512.6 Insert “Roof covering materials. In all occupancies, no roof
materials shall be constructed over or enclosed within a new roof or new
structure”.
   Section 1809.9.3 Insert “Rubble stone foundation walls. New rubble stone
foundation walls are not permitted".
   Section 1809.12 Timber footings. Delete and replace with “New wood
foundation walls are not permitted”.
   Section 1807.1.6.2 Concrete foundation walls. Insert new "8. All foundation
walls shall be a minimum of six (6) inches higher than the adjacent finished
grade level".
   Chapter 29. Delete in its entirety and insert "See the Illinois State
Plumbing Code".
   Appendix G. (Flood-resistant construction) to the International Building
Code is adopted. (Ord. 19-09-16, 9-17-2019; amd. Ord. 24-12-19, 12-17-2024)

8-7-4: AMENDMENTS TO THE 2024 INTERNATIONAL RESIDENTIAL CODE:
The following sections of the 2024 International Residential Code are hereby
added, amended, revised, and changed as follows:
   General Amendments

   Wherever the phrase "Code Official" or "Department of Building Inspection"
appears, it shall refer to the Village of Riverwoods, Director of Community
Services or his designated agent(s).
   Whenever there is a reference to the "Village of Riverwoods Schedule" or any
other general reference to fees or charges, it shall mean the then-current
ordinance of the Village setting forth fees, charges, and other costs payable
to the Village relating to activities covered by, and the administration of,
